entry.title: immersive fullscreen: fix toolbar visibility in content fullscreen
entry.content:
In certain circumstances the toolbar is visible in content fullscreen.

This CL addresses this by adding the ability to toggle ignoring reveal

locks. Reveal locks are now ignored while in content fullscreen.



The RevealLock() and RevealUnlock() functions have been refactored to

just keep track of the locks and are no longer virtual.

RevealLocked() and RevealUnlocked() have been added to apply the visual

changes.



Since we are now handling reveal locks properly in content fullscreen

we also need to recalculate GetMinimumContentOffset() when in content

fullscreen. Otherwise the find bar being active will shrink the content

to fit the now hidden toolbar, leaving a big ugly band at the top of the

screen.



There are a couple more edge cases still to handle. Namely the "nested"

browser fullscreen -> content fullscreen case. Reveal locks during that

transition need to be handled differently, but I will save that for

the next CL. Also we need to stop migrating child windows from the

browser to the overlay widget while in content fullscreen. This will

also be addressed in a separate CL.



Bug: 1481751

Change-Id: I925a05b2c5f4ff401300b4fb2781b5ebecd258ed

entry.title: LinkPreview: Do not set WebContentsDelegate on WebContents creation
entry.content:
I introduced a way to set WebContentsDeletgate while constructing

WebContents via WebContents::CreateParams to tell the preview mode

before constructing the first RenderFrameHost that happens while

constructing it. This is needed to tell the capability control

system to setup a right restriction on RenderFrameHost creation.

On the other hand, when we set WebContentsDelegate while constructing

it, the instance will call delegate's callbacks, and it indirectly

reaches a code path that assumes the WebContents is ready. One of such

code paths is DevTools' agent that will be attached on setting the

delegate and it requires initialized FrameTree and so on.



This patch changes the WebContents construction to take a boolean

flag instead of delegate so that we can avoid calling delegate'

callbacks before completing WebContents initialization, and can

tell the RenderFrameHost the correct preview mode on time.



Change-Id: I3b9695ccdc5e68640bf4709c94bec356d0d438ef

Bug: 1510978

entry.title: matcher EqualsProto - print textproto output
entry.content:
EqualsProto currently prints binary protos, which results in data being

unreadable and/or truncated. Ideally, we would print out the protobuf

message in a readable form, but MessageLite is incapable of this.

Instead, we can parse the raw proto into a Message(non-lite), and

print that as a text proto. This shows field numbers instead of names,

but mostly preserves the message structure.



This cl uses test_proto_loader to avoid linking to protobuf_full.

I updated test_proto_loader so that it doesn't include protobuf-full

headers in the header, to fix trybot errors. And updated it to

allow passing the descriptor set data in as a serialized protobuf

string, rather than a file path -- as some tests weren't able to

find the generated descriptor set file at runtime.



Change-Id: Ibbcaf7662a03a8fef47d0068d521a22cd5a45872

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234952

Commit-Queue: Dan H

Reviewed-by: Daniel Cheng

entry.title: [Hub][Tab Switcher] Fix crash if TabModelSelector initialization is slow
entry.content:
If TabModelSelector#onTabStateInitialized happened after the Hub was

shown a crash could happen as the TabSwitcherPane would have an

incomplete TabModelFilter, but the TabListMediator would have no

TabModelFilter yet.



This CL fixes that by copying the init logic for the TabListMediator's

TabModelFilter to use the same logic as the TabSwitcherMediator rather

than using the new and more timing sensitive implementation from

TabSwitcherPaneCoordinatorFactory.



The key difference is that this allows the TabListMediator to be

shown before tab state is fully initialized, and after initialization

finishes the UI will be refreshed to account for any slow tab restores.

Whereas before if tab state wasn't initialized we would just crash.



Fixed: 1522518

Change-Id: I1271c0d713a5b60cb53c4cd0225300f90cfc6d4b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5246845

entry.content:
This ports the remainder of TabSwitcherMediator#recordUserSwitchedTab

to work with Hub. Because there isn't a mechanism for inter-pane

communication this is layered atop Hub and just observes a bunch of

Hub related events. It should be structured nearly identically to the

prior implementation, but is built on a handful of observers rather

where we passed the current index rather than the last ID to the

didSelectTab event.

entry.title: media: Skip unnecessary synchronization in PaintCanvasVideoRenderer
entry.content:
Skip unnecessary synchronization in PaintCanvasVideoRenderer::Paint -

UpdateLastImage calls SynchronizeVideoFrameRead since it's copying from

the video frame, but Paint also calls SynchronizeVideoFrameRead even

though it's not reading from the video frame directly - only from the

cached texture. This extra synchronization is costly because it has a

GenSyncToken call which uses synchronous IPC to the GPU process.

entry.title: [QuickStart] Fix resume after update
entry.content:
This CL fixes the automatic resume after an update and integrates this

edgecase with the OOBE QS UI flow. I added a unittest to help prevent

entry.title: desk_profiles: Fix truncated icons at various zoom levels
entry.content:
At certain display scales, the round profile avatar icon would appear

slightly truncated. This CL fixes that issue, and also does a bunch of

simplifications in DeskProfileButton.



The profile button inherits from ImageButton, but was manually adding an

IconView as child. This is a bit pointless since ImageButton already has

the capability of showing an image (that's what it does). The child view

was therefore removed.



Additionally, since the class is already implementing the Desk::Observer

interface, we can let the profile button handle profile changes itself,

rather than having DeskMiniView do that.



BUG=b:316627950



Change-Id: I0cab0ce3b9f303cbbd0dcf5fbd7752ce72a81cfe

entry.title: Minor PassKey cleanups.
entry.content:
* Remove unnecessary base:: qualifiers

* Move from runtime to compile-time tests

* Add tests of copying/moving passkeys

* Use =default



The last point deserves explanation. Existing code dating to the first

patchset of the commit that introduced PassKey explicitly avoided

=default to "prevent uniform initialization". But it's not clear what

that means; it's possible to uniform-init PassKeys (and in fact the

tests test for this), so this seems to have no effect. Furthermore,

while there is style guidance around when uniform init should be used,

that doesn't extend so far as to try and make types prevent it.



Bug: none

entry.title: [LCPP] Add UMAs for automatic preconnect experiment.
entry.content:
Automatic Preconnect to LCP Origins experiments attempts to learn

LCP image origins using LCPP framework, and use that information to

preconnect to LCP origins using the ResourcePrefetchPredictor

infrastructure. The experiment aims at executing a preconnect to

the LCP origin prior to navigation, and help improve LCP of sites

with a cross-origin image asset as the LCP element.



This CL adds UMAs to track accuracy of prediction (measure if

the predicted origins turned to be the actual LCP image origins).

entry.title: [FSA] Remove kOneTimePermission flag dependency
entry.content:
Previously, certain features of FSA persistent permission, such as

active grants revocation upon tab closure (not timer-based) or

backgrounded tab, depended on `kOneTimePermission` flag. However,

`kOneTimePermission` intends to guard its UI, not the helper functions

(i.e. `OneTimePermissionsTracker`). This CL enables the usage of

OTPTracker for File System Access, by checking its flag as well:

`kFileSystemAccessPersistentPermission`.



This change will be cherrypicked to M122 so that it can provide

better active permission revoking flow, which is not timer-based,

as the FSA persistent permission launch is slated for M122.



Bug: 1522862

entry.title: Add js_in_process_fuzzer.
entry.content:
This is demonstration fuzzer which runs arbitrary JavaScript

in the context of a browser_test. It's unlikely to be an

effective or efficient fuzzer in itself, because:



* it gathers coverage data for the whole browser, which is slow

* there is no cunning mutation at all, not even AST mutation

let alone the IL-based mutation which is the current state

of the art



However in future with sufficient work on more targeted

coverage guidance, dictionaries, corpora and maybe a future

mutator, it could be effective. The advantage of this approach

is that we can run JavaScript within the full realistic

Chromium browser and so may be able to gather coverage

guidance on web IDL implementations. Moreover, because

it's in-tree, we should be able autogenerate dictionaries to

keep them up to date with the ever-changing WebIDL and perhaps

spot shallow problems in new web APIs as soon as they're

introduced. Subsequent CLs will move in that direction.



Change-Id: Ic5dabb9b4b1721af0ba9b2e094791742b7c85d23

entry.title: Use simpler format to move handle closer config to child
entry.content:
This CL changes the way the broker tells a target (child) which

handles should be closed prior to lockdown.



The flexible AddKernelObjectToClose(type,name) is replaced

by a more constrained AddKernelObjectToClose(HandleToClose enum) and

the HandleToClose enum is added to the sandbox_policy.h definitions.

This restricts the set of closeable handles to ones hardcoded in

the sandbox and makes these methods return void().



The handles_to_close_ map that held (type => name) in handle_closer.h

is replaced with a struct of boolean (uint8_t) fields for each

possible enum value of HandleToClose.



The serialization code to transfer this map to bytes and to the

target is replaced with a single transfer of this packed struct.

The configuration is written into g_handle_closer_info in the

target handle_closer_agent.cc and the map deserialization code is

removed.



Matching handles to close is now a single-phase operation. Previously

all process handles would be enumerated and stuffed into a map of

type => [list of handles], and, in a second phase, the (type => name)

map from the broker would be walked along with this map of handles

to identify which handles should be closed. This is replaced by a

single phase operation which walks the enumerated process handles

and closes them if they match one of the conditions set in the

transferred config struct.



The handle closer agent now includes hardcoded paths to test against

(and these paths are no longer needed in the broker). The path to

\BaseNamedObjects\windows_shell_global_counters was previously

prepended with the active session. Instead it is now matched by

using EndsWith.



Because the two-phase approach could identify if the ALPC Port for

csrss would be closed the first phase indicated to target_services

that extra csrss warmup and cleanup was necessary. This is now folded

into the action taken inside handle_closer_agent.cc if the

bDisconnectCsrss flag was provided.



Finally the handle closer can no longer close arbitrary files so

handle_closer_tests now operate on a handle to \Device\KsecDD.

The tests create this handle to ensure it is present if cryptbase.dll

is not loaded.



Bug: 1521559

Change-Id: I84f160f8d462b2fedc2e7994e70d2981085d6526

entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Fix RunBatchUrlScoringModel for document suggestions.
entry.content:
When using the AutocompleteController::RunBatchUrlScoringModel()

function, the ML Scoring algorithm will sometimes assign the same ML

score to different document suggestions. This is especially problematic

when dealing with remote document suggestions which do not have any

corresponding local scoring signals. In this case, since the algorithm

makes use of a max heap (std::priority_queue) ordered by the ML scores,

the resultant tie-breaking behavior consistently results in the worst

document suggestions getting surfaced to the user, whereas the legacy

scoring algorithm would have selected the best ones.



This CL addresses the problem by inserting tuples of

(ml_score, legacy_score, match_itr) into the max heap, instead of pairs

of (ml_score, match_itr), so that the ML Scoring algorithm will utilize

the traditional scores in order to break ties between two remote

document suggestions that have been assigned equal ML scores.



Bug: 1520685

Change-Id: Id52561490b05983a4429efe750dfc0d86e4d6321

entry.title: Rename {absl => std}::optional in //services/
entry.content:
#cleanup



Automated patch. This is a no-op. Please avoid, as much as possible,

assigning unrelated bugs to this.



Context:

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/cxx/c/nBD_1LaanTc/m/ghh-ZZhWAwAJ?utm_medium=email



As of https://crrev.com/1204351, absl::optional is now a type alias

for std::optional. We should migrate toward it.



Script:

```

cd services/

function replace {

echo "Replacing $1 by $2"

git grep -l "$1" \

| cut -f1 -d: \

| grep \

-e "\.h" \

-e "\.cc" \

-e "\.mm" \

| sort \

| uniq \

| xargs sed -i "s/$1/$2/g"

}

replace "absl::make_optional" "std::make_optional"

replace "absl::optional" "std::optional"

replace "absl::nullopt" "std::nullopt"

replace "absl::in_place" "std::in_place"

replace "absl::in_place_t" "std::in_place_t"

replace "\"third_party\/abseil-cpp\/absl\/types\/optional.h\"" ""

cd ..



echo "Formatting:"



echo "IncludeBlocks: Regroup" >> ".clang-format"

echo "IncludeIsMainRegex: \"(_(android|apple|chromeos|freebsd|fuchsia|fuzzer|ios|linux|mac|nacl|openbsd|posix|stubs?|win))?(_(unit|browser|perf)?tests?)?$\"" >> ".clang-format"

git cl format

git restore ".clang-format"



git cl format

```



Bug: chromium:1500249

Change-Id: I385b921706afb8d5a49623d7d4a5828886b10d56

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5244550

Commit-Queue: Arthur Sonzogni

entry.title: desk_profiles: Actually propagate profile removals to desks
entry.content:
When a lacros profile is removed, this event is propagated to the ash

side, and then on to interested observers. Desks are one of those

observers, but the crucial link between DeskProfilesAsh and

DesksController was missing (whoops). This CL fills in that blank.



This fixes an issue where the profile avatar would go blank if the desk

was associated with a removed profile. The interfaces were all there,

but the line wasn't connected.



There are also some changes made to TestDeskProfilesDelegate so that it

implements the observer interface, so that we can easily verify things

from a unit test.

entry.title: [Gardener] Revert "[base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask."
entry.content:
This reverts commit aa9fbff84283de17fe0ee59c28c9edd50b7e6d3a.



Reason for revert: suspected to cause persistent failures in ToolbarControllerUiTest.DeactivatedActionItemsOverflow on https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/win-arm64-rel-ready.



First failing build: https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/win-arm64-rel-ready/18427/test-results



Sample output:

https://chrome-swarming.appspot.com/task?id=676f0f21d35f4f11&o=true&w=true



The failure stack has a bunch of scheduling and sequence-related things, ending with ui::test::internal::InteractiveTestPrivate::OnSequenceAborted(). There were only three CLs in the blamelist, and the other two seemed much less likely to be related.



Original change's description:

> [base] Integrate (Sequenced|SingleThread)TaskRunner::GetCurrentDefault with RunOrPostTask.

>

> Within a RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously:

>

> - There is no "current default SingleThreadTaskRunner".

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback cannot make assumptions about the thread

> on which it runs, so it shouldn't access the current default

> SingleThreadTaskRunner.

>

> - The "current default SequencedTaskRunner" is the SequenceManager's

> default task runner.

>

> A RunOrPostTask() callback runs in sequence with tasks from the

> target SequenceManager. It's appropriate for it to access the

> "current default" SequencedTaskRunner.

>

> Also, with this CL, when

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::BelongsToCurrentThread() is invoked on a

> task runner that runs tasks posted to it "in sequence" with the

> current RunOrPostTask callback running synchronously, but on

> a different thread, it returns `false`. In the same context,

> SingleThreadTaskRunner::RunsTasksInCurrentSequence() returns true.

>

> Bug: 1503967

> Change-Id: I017442f10eddda9070a29fb6cf0fa38dcd14a88c

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5138135

> Reviewed-by: Ken Rockot

> Code-Coverage: findit-for-me@appspot.gserviceaccount.com

> Reviewed-by: Etienne Pierre-Doray

> Commit-Queue: Francois Pierre Doray

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1253287}

entry.title: [EditContext] Don't crash in debug builds with DOMRects containing NaN
entry.content:
When EditContext.updateCharacterBounds, updateControlBounds, or

updateSelectionBounds is given a DOMRect with an undefined/NaN

dimension, this causes a crash in debug builds.

DOMRect::ToEnclosingRect uses ClampTo which DHECKS if the given

number is NaN.



Fix this by instead using a version of Clamp that coerces NaN to

0 without DHECKing.



Bug: 999184

entry.title: Reduce references to `Layout()` in comments: ash/
entry.content:
Where possible, change comments to talk about "layout" (the process)

instead of "Layout()" (the method). Ultimately we want most of the

process of layout to be performed by layout managers, not directly in

Layout(), so this makes comments more future-proof. This also reduces

the number of string search hits for "Layout()" when making sure we

audit overrides.

entry.title: [sync] Introduce gaia-keyed custom passphrase pref
entry.content:
If a custom passphrase user signs out and back in again, they shouldn't

have to enter their passphrase again. More details in crbug.com/1471928.



To remember the custom passphrase after signing out, this CL:

* Introduces a new gaia-keyed pref for custom passphrase

* Introduces GetEncryptionBootstrapTokenForAccount and

SetEncryptionBootstrapTokenForAccount in SyncPrefs for the new pref.

* Plumbs EncryptionBootstrapToken through SyncUserSettingsImpl to

control when to use the new pref based on the account state (should

not affect syncing users)

* Adds corresponding tests

* All changes are gated by kSyncRememberCustomPassphraseAfterSignout



Bug: 1471928

entry.title: [LCPP] Auto-preconnect to LCP origins experiment: write path.
entry.content:
This CL implements the write path of automatic preconnect to LCP

origins experiment.



Automatic Preconnect to LCP Origins experiments attempts to learn LCP

image origins using LCPP framework, and use that information to

preconnect to LCP origins using the ResourcePrefetchPredictor

infrastructure. The experiment aims at executing a preconnect to

the LCP origin prior to navigation, and help improve LCP of sites

with a cross-origin image asset as the LCP element.

entry.title: Rename element getters in form_util
entry.content:
After the launch of AutofillUseDomNodeIdForRendererId, getting blink

element by renderer ids became much more efficient.



Previously, we would need to iterate over all elements until we find

the element with corresponding renderer id. Now we can simply use the

weak (DOMNodeId, Node) map provided to us by blink.



This CL reflects this optimization by renaming FindFooByRendererId to

GetFooByRendererId.



The CL also removes vector-based function that was initially there to

reduce the number of iteration over all elements, and which is not

needed since we do not iterate of all elements anymore.

entry.content:
No behavioral changes, as the new code, namely

BookmarkLoadDetails::AddAccountPermanentNodes(), isn't exercised outside

tests and the rest of the changes are pure refactorings without

behavioral changes.



The patch implements part of the plumbing required to load account

bookmarks into BookmarkModel. In this first step, BookmarkLoadDetails

consumption in BookmarkModel::DoneLoading(). However, it remains

practically unused until future patches implement the actual loading

from disk via BookmarkCodec.

entry.title: Restructure AddressDataCleaner
entry.content:
- Moves DedupeProfiles() to an anonymous namespace in the cc file, since

it doesn't/shouldn't depend on anything but the passed in vector of

profiles. Renames the function to DeduplicateProfiles().

- Removes and rephrases many stating-the-obvious comments.

- Removes the "profiles" infix from some variable names. Now that the

address and payments cleaners are separate classes, this is obvious.

- Removes is_autofill_profile_dedupe_pending_ and instead just reads the

pref directly.

- Moves the logic to populate the PopulateAlternativeStateNameMap from

MaybeCleanupAddressData() to ApplyAddressDedupingRoutine(), since only

the deduplication depends on it.

- Moves the pref checking to run deduplication at most once per

milestone into MaybeCleanupAddressData(), so it is the one function

coordinating how often each of the private functions are run.

- Renames ApplyAddressDedupingRoutine() to ApplyDeduplicationRoutine().

- Reorders the constructor's arguments by perceived order of relevants.

actually impact the user visible behavior, since it's likely due

to the browser terminating (for unrelated reasons) while the

child is being started. This change will suppress such crash

reports.
